section_id: ## 7. Conclusion and Impact on HK Convergence Theory

hints.label: thm-hk-convergence-conditional
hints.title: Exponential HK-Convergence of the Fragile Gas (CONDITIONAL ON SURVIVAL)
hints.content:
1852: :label: thm-hk-convergence-conditional
1853: 
1854: Under the foundational axioms of the Euclidean Gas (`01_fragile_gas_framework.md`, `02_euclidean_gas.md`, `03_cloning.md`), the empirical measure $\mu_t$ converges exponentially to the quasi-stationary distribution $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ in the Hellinger-Kantorovich metric:
1855: 
1856: $$
1857: \text{HK}(\mu_t, \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \leq C_{\text{HK}} e^{-\kappa_{\text{HK}} t}
1858: 
1859: $$
1860: 
1861: with explicit rate $\kappa_{\text{HK}} = \kappa_{\text{HK}}(\gamma, \sigma_v, \sigma_x, U, R, N) > 0$.
1862: 
1863: **Status**: CONDITIONAL ON SURVIVAL (standard in QSD theory)
1864: 
1865: **Scope**:
1866: 1. **Finite horizon**: For any $T < \infty$, the HK convergence bound holds with probability $\geq 1 - CT e^{-\delta N}$ for all $t \in [0, T]$
1867: 2. **Infinite horizon**: On the survival event $\{\tau_\dagger = \infty\}$, the HK convergence bound holds deterministically for all $t \geq 0$
